extracted_topics.abstract: Leaders often feel isolated when making crucial agency decisions without proper support
Decision-making in isolation can lead to significant stress and costly mistakes
The burden of strategic decisions falling solely on leaders creates overwhelming pressure
Market uncertainty makes decision-making more complex and breeds insecurity
Creating a Strategic Decisions Committee can provide multiple perspectives and reduce leader burden
Building support networks helps alleviate leadership loneliness
External advisors bring objectivity and expertise to strategic decision-making
Regular team discussions improve decision quality and reduce isolation
Mentorship and leadership groups provide valuable decision-making resources
Supported leaders make more informed and balanced decisions
